Row.Text: Welcome to Kosovo. My name is Ibrahim Rugova, President of the Republic of Kosovo. As a token of our newfound relations, I offer to you a visit to my collection of many crystals.
You might have defeated me, yes, but the spirit of Kosovo will live on. Remember that well, for my people will never forget.
We yearn only to be recognised... But you are no different than the others. Kosovo will not stand to be just another piece within your wicked empire.
You are a friend of Kosovo, yes? So let us celebrate this friendship with this beautiful crystal of my collection.
You have proven to be a threat to our nationality. As such, I cannot trust you.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
In the name of the Republic of Kosovo, I have to declare war upon you. Know that it is yours ways that led us to this.
You have reached within rightful kosovar territory, and as such, I require you to stay away from us.
You seem willing to make peace. I guess I will listen to you, then.
Welcome, my friend.
Welcome.
Be quick.
We can see your forces at the border. Turn back now.
Our people are now building kullas and enjoy playing the lahuta. We're worried the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.
We are glad to see that your people are building kullas and playing the lahuta. The amazing works of our civilization are truly inspiring!
I'm listening.
You think this is a victory?. As long as our people remain on this Earth Kosovo will stand.
Our people are interested in these resources.Would you mind trading them?
I refuse your peace.
I propose that we open our borders to one another.
I would like you to leave, please. No crystals for you.
The people of Kosovo are suffering. Would you please help us?
I do not think this was the best diplomatic move.
You should pay the price of your actions first.
Kosovo is free from oppression! May this victory embolden other nations who seek to end your cruel regime.
